Description.Name: Safety Checks
Description.Details: You are in the cargo bay surveying the aftermath of the door failure earlier when Darius and Dr. Murad approach you, "Commander, here is the safety audit report you ordered on the Argo." You take the datapad from Darius and scan the data. Your brow furrows as you hand it back to him, "You mean to tell me this ship is riddled with potentially faulty bolts that could fail at any moment?" Dr. Murad clears her throat, "Commander, do keep in mind that the Argo was built in 2762. There are a lot of parts of her that are ancient by all counts." At that moment, Yang wanders over, "Don't go giving me that bullshit story. This ship has been refurbished so many times it's ridiculous. Bottom line is Boeing Interstellar cut corners and we're losing key personel cause of it!" You rub your temples to try and ward off the pending headache, "Okay, enough. Darius, what is it going to take to prevent this from happening again?" Darius reads from his datapad, "Well Commander, we have the following options: Purchase replacment bolts and manually do the job ourselves. [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] has mentioned being willing to assist with external repair work; Hire a repair crew from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]] to expedite the repairs professionally; or do nothing and revisit this later hoping it doesn't happen again in the mean time. What do you wish to do, Commander?"

Description.Name: Find a Repair Crew
Description.Details:
"I could've handled it," [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] argues for a moment, but your withering stare gives {SCN_MW.Obj} pause and {SCN_MW.SUBJ} quickly {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:drop|Default:drops} the subject.

You turn back to Darius, "Let's get a repair crew up here to take care of this."

Later that day, Darius knocks on your office door, "Commander, bad news.  I was unable to locate any companies on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]] that have the equipment and personel to replace the failing door bolts.  We are going to need to find a system that has it's own manufacturing industy or come up with another way of fixing the issue."

You rub your face in your hands before responding to Darius, "Okay.  Let's look for a nearby system that can assist us and hope we do not have another accident before then."

Description.Name: repaired
Description.Details: "I thought you trusted me, Commander," [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] mutters, visibly sagging, but {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:drop|Default:drops} the subject as you instruct Darius to organise the repairs. Thankfully, while over-priced, the repair crew are expedient and efficient and waste no time in flying up from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]] to begin replacing all the faulty hatch bolts on the Argo. There are no further issues with the Argo, but you notice {SCN_MW.Callsign} lingering in the observation deck for the next couple of weeks, {SCN_MW.DET} gaze fixed on the view of the Argo's hull. {SCN_MW.DET_C} mind is elsewhere as {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:attend|Default:attends} to {SCN_MW.DET} daily tasks.

Description.Name: Send {SCN_MW.Callsign} out to replace the bolts.
failure
Description.Details: You have Darius purchase the bolts from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]], which arrive on the next dropship. You watch from a viewscreen as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], in EVA suit, struggles with the low gravity and the oxygen hose anchoring {SCN_MW.OBJ} to the Argo. It is painfully obvious the tools feel awkward in {SCN_MW.DET} hands. You wince as {SCN_MW.Subj} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:lose|Default:loses} {SCN_MW.DET} grip on the spanner and as it floats away, {SCN_MW.Subj} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:spill|Default:spills} a number of bolts out into space in the attempt to retreive it. You motion to Darius to end the repairs before [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] finds a way to float off into space as well. Later, after you visit {SCN_MW.Callsign} in the MedBay, you receive a hull integrity report from Dr. Murad. "Less than 10% of the bolts were replaced." She sighs. "We will need to be vigilent until we can exact proper replacement of the remaining bolts."

Description.Name: success
Description.Details: You have Darius purchase the bolts from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]], which arrive on the next dropship. You watch from a viewscreen as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], in an EVA suit, bounces and floats across the Argo. {SCN_MW.Callsign} slowly and methodically begins to replace the faulty bolts, one by one. After 6 hours, {SCN_MW.Callsign} is reeled safely back inside the Argo for a much needed break. You leave them in the care of Darious and Yang knowing it is going to take {SCN_MW.Obj} the better part of 30 days and multiple space walks to replace the thousands of bolts that could be faulty. At the end of it, hull integrity is at 100% and everyone on board are no longer stressed about thier safety. Throughout the next couple weeks, you notice that {SCN_MW.Callsign} attends to {SCN_MW.DET} daily tasks with newfound enthusiasm. When you call the MechWarriors, {SCN_MW.Callsign} is first to line up.

Description.Name: Send {SCN_MW.Callsign} out to replace the bolts.
success + high spirits
Description.Details: You have Darius purchase the bolts from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]], which arrive on the next dropship. You watch from a viewscreen as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], in an EVA suit, floats nimbly across the puckered hull of the DropShip. {SCN_MW.Callsign} deftly replaces the numerous bolts along this section of the Argo. After a few hours, {SCN_MW.Callsign} is reeled safely back inside the ship to take a break. At this pace, all of the bolts should be replaced in a couple of weeks. Throughout the next couple of weeks, you notice that {SCN_MW.Callsign} attends to {SCN_MW.DET} daily tasks with newfound enthusiasm.

Description.Name: success + injury
Description.Details: You have Darius purchase the bolts from [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]], which arrive on the next dropship. You watch from a viewscreen as [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]], in an EVA suit, floats nimbly across the puckered hull of the DropShip. {SCN_MW.Callsign} deftly replaces the numerous bolts along this section of the Argo. After a few hours, {SCN_MW.Callsign} is reeled safely back inside the ship to take a break. At this pace, all of the bolts should be replaced in a couple of weeks. On {SCN_MW.Callsign}'s last EVA to replace the remaining bolts, you learn that {SCN_MW.Callsign} was injured when a bolt shot out and punctured thier suit. You visit {SCN_MW.OBJ} in the MedBay. "You did some amazing work out there, {SCN_MW.Callsign}," you say. "Anyone else would have hesitated in a situation like that, fearfull that the whole hatch would blow out. I've already punished the crew responsible for not having that section depressurised in advance of your repair work." You hand {SCN_MW.Obj} the bolt they removed during surgery, conveniently made into a necklace.
